questions.text: An elderly male presents with halitosis and aspiration of food at night. On examination, there is a gurgling sound on neck palpation. Barium studies is as below. What is the diagnosis?

  • ➤ Zenker's diverticulum, or pharyngeal pouch, is a false diverticulum arising from Killian’s dehiscence. It presents with halitosis, nocturnal aspiration, and a gurgling sound on neck palpation, visible as an outpouching on barium swallow imaging.

questions.text: Two months following Billroth 2 reconstruction, patient complaints of lightheadedness and diarrhoea 15 mins after certain meals. He is suffering from?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Early dumping

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Early dumping syndrome occurs within 10-15 minutes of eating, primarily due to rapid gastric emptying and osmotic fluid shifts into the intestine, leading to hypotension and diarrhea. This is common after surgeries that alter gastric structure, such as Billroth II.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male, who has history of chronic NSAID usage presents with hematemesis and abdominal pain. On endoscopy an actively bleeding peptic ulcer was seen which was around 1.5cm in size. The ulcer was located on the posterior wall of the duodenum. Choose the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: H2 antagonists/PPIs with regular follow up

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Inj. Adrenaline with clips

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In an actively bleeding peptic ulcer, dual endotherapy (e.g., adrenaline injection plus clips or coagulation) is the preferred first-line treatment for optimal control and reduced re-bleeding risk.

questions.text: Identify the finding on endoscopy in the image shown:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) GAVE

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gastric Antral Vascular Ectasia (GAVE), or watermelon stomach, presents with ectatic vessels in the gastric antrum that form red streaks, resembling a watermelon rind. This appearance distinguishes it from other gastric lesions and vascular anomalies.

questions.text: A 65-year-old male with early satiety and weight loss, was diagnosed with gastric carcinoma. On examination, a swelling was noticed in the left supra clavicular region. What is this sign known as?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Troisier’s sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Troisier’s sign refers to the presence of an enlarged left supraclavicular lymph node (Virchow's node), which is a clinical indicator of metastatic spread from cancers of the stomach, breast, bronchus, or colorectal and reproductive organs.

questions.text: Which of the following is commonly seen after bariatric gastric bypass surgery?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Iron deficiency anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron deficiency anemia is a common complication after Roux-en-Y gastric bypass surgery due to bypassing the duodenum and proximal jejunum, the primary sites for iron absorption.

questions.text: During diagnostic laparoscopy for chronic abdominal pain, small bowel was noted to have finding as shown. Likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Crohn’s

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Creeping fat, characterized by mesenteric fat wrapping around the intestine towards the anti-mesenteric border, is a hallmark feature of Crohn’s disease and helps distinguish it from other gastrointestinal pathologies.

questions.text: A 8-year boy presents with h/o bleeding PR. Colonoscopy shows blood but site of bleed cannot be identified. BMFT is as shown. What is the treatment?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Wedge resection

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Meckel’s diverticulum, especially in pediatric patients presenting with PR bleeding, may contain ectopic gastric mucosa that can cause ulceration and bleeding. Surgical treatment depends on the base of the diverticulum: narrow-based lesions can be managed with wedge resection, while broad-based lesions require resection and anastomosis.

questions.text: Incorrect statement about short bowel syndrome:

options.label: A
options.text: Most common cause in infant is necrotising enterocolitis

options.label: C
options.text: Resection of proximal small bowel is less tolerated than distal

options.label: D
options.text: Intestinal length alone is not a predictor of outcome

questions.correct_answer: C. Resection of proximal small bowel is less tolerated than distal
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Resection of proximal small bowel is less tolerated than distal

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In short bowel syndrome, the tolerance to resection varies with the segment removed. The ileum, especially the terminal ileum, plays a critical role in nutrient absorption, and its loss is poorly tolerated. Conversely, resection of the proximal small intestine (jejunum) is better tolerated. Additionally, short bowel syndrome can lead to oxalate stone formation due to increased absorption of oxalates in the colon (enteric hyperoxaluria).

questions.text: Identify:

  • ➤ Virtual colonoscopy, or CT colonography, uses CT imaging to create 3D reconstructions of the colon, allowing for non-invasive screening and diagnosis of colonic abnormalities. It is particularly useful in patients who may not tolerate traditional colonoscopy.

questions.text: 35-year-old female is brought to casualty with abdominal pain and diarrhoea. She is a known case of sigmoid diverticular disease. She undergoes laparotomy and is found to have fecal collection in pelvis and paracolic gutters. What is her Hinchey stage?

questions.text: Which of these vessels are ligated at the root in right hemicolectomy for CA cecum? Ileocolic artery Superior mesenteric artery Right colic artery Middle colic artery
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a right hemicolectomy for CA cecum, the ileocolic and right colic arteries are ligated at the root to ensure complete oncological resection. The middle colic artery's right branch is ligated if needed, but its root is not ligated unless performing an extended right hemicolectomy for more proximal tumors.

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Narrow band imaging

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Narrow band imaging (NBI) utilizes blue and green light to improve visualization of submucosal blood vessels and mucosal structures during endoscopy, enhancing the detection of potential lesions without the use of dyes.

  • ➤ Flexible gastroscopy: first investigation

questions.text: 45/M presents with retrosternal burning pain. UGI scopy shows tongue like projections at GE junction. Biopsy reveals goblet cells with low grade intestinal dysplasia. Next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) RFA+EMR

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with Barrett's esophagus and low-grade dysplasia, endoscopic radiofrequency ablation (RFA) with endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR) is recommended to prevent progression to esophageal adenocarcinoma.

questions.text: Identify the organism for which this test is performed:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) H pylori

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The CLOtest is a rapid urease test used to detect H. pylori infection from a gastric antral biopsy obtained during endoscopy. A positive result indicates the presence of urease activity, which is specific to H. pylori in the gastric mucosa.

questions.text: Most satisfactory surgical treatment for duodenal ulcers:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Highly selective vagotomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Highly selective vagotomy is the preferred surgical treatment for duodenal ulcers as it effectively reduces acid secretion with minimal disruption to gastric function, thus lowering the risk of postoperative complications and recurrence.

questions.text: D2 lymphadenectomy for CA stomach entails removal of all of these stations except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Station 12

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ D2 lymphadenectomy for gastric cancer involves removing lymph node stations 1–11. Station 12 and beyond are not included in D2 and are part of a more extensive D3 lymphadenectomy.
